item.title: Sentiment Analysis: Limits and Progress of the Syuzhet Package and Its Lexicons
item.author: Hoyeol Kim
item.description: 1. Introduction Text mining is no longer an uncommon research method when it comes to analyzing texts in the digital humanities. Once limited to the research field, text mining now influences “our lives, our teaching, and our scholarship, and digital humanists” 1 as “a logocentric practice.” 2 Sentiment analysis, also known as opinion mining, shares common features with text mining when parsing, detecting, and locating words or sentences. Sentiment analysis is “the process of extracting an author’s emotional intent from text.
